bibl.title: Letter from C.C Bass to Henry Rose Carter, March 20, 1919

div1.p: Bass thanks Carter for contributing a paper on yellow fever for the American Society of Tropical Medicine meeting.

div1.head: Letter from C.C Bass to Henry Rose Carter, March 20, 1919
div1.opener:
LABORATORY OF CLINICAL MEDICINE
Miscl-
Y. F.
Bass
The College of Medicine
School of Medicine
Tulane University of Louisiana
P. O. BOX 770
NEW ORLEANS, LA., March 20, 1919
Dr. H. R. Carter,
U.S. Public Health Service,
U.S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am just in receipt of your letter of 16th instant and
am glad to know that you will contribute a paper on the subject of
yellow fever at the next meeting of the American Society of Tropical
Medicine. It will be satisfactory, in the event that you find it
necessary to do so, for you to speak from notes as you suggest and
for you to prepare and submit a paper later. Please let us have the
title of the paper at your convenience, not later than April 15 if
possible.

I find upon investigation that the paper presented by
Doctor Rivas at the last meeting and discussed by yourself and others
was not furnished to the secretary. This is the explanation for its
not appearing in the Transactions.

I do hope that you will soon be all right from your sprained
ankle and will be feeling quite well again.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, C. C. Bass
S.M. The spontaneous
Elimination
of Y.f. in E from
Endemic Centers.
Over for
Answer
